title: Question:
author: NotATether
created_time: October 07, 2022, 05:25:43 AMLast edit: October 08, 2022, 08:26:22 AM by NotATether
content: I asked Theymos if I can get a factoid for BitcoinCleanup, and he directed me here, so here we are.The factoid that is going to be added is:QuoteBitcoinCleanup.com: Debunking false claims of Proof of Work causing climate changeThe poll tells whether or not somebody wants a factoid for this at all, not if someone likes the wording of this particular factoid. If you have a suggestion for a modification of the factoid text, then post it here.This poll will expire in 2 weeks and the results will be taken from that time.EDIT:This is the new factoid:QuoteBitcoinCleanup.com: Learn why Bitcoin isn't bad for the environment

comments.author: shahzadafzal
comments.body: Definitely support itI like it this wayQuoteBitcoinCleanup.com: Debunking false claims of Proof of Work Bitcoin causing climate change

It could be a factoid in this forum too.Quoteendthefud.org: Debunking Bitcoin FUD

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: I'll go for a yes. As it will fall to "interesting" and "useful" base on the description theymos provide for a factoid.Quote from: theymos on March 21, 2018, 07:21:49 PMDoes anyone have any suggestions for new factoids?Â - They should be less than about 300 visible characters long.Â - They can contain links and basic styling.Â - A random forum user reading a random factoid should have a good chance of thinking that it was interesting, funny, or useful.But for me it would be better if the factoid will not sounds as an ad. Like eureka, facts and studies, maybe like..."Did you know that America's electronics use more energy than Bitcoin. For more facts about Bitcoin Proof of Work mining check Bitcoincleanup.com"Or same in the BPIP factoids format."Did you know that Bitcoin Proof of Work Mining is actually **Good for the environment?""Did you know that Most of Bitcoin PoW environment myths are not true?"Well, that just for me though, most of the quoted above are taken from the website btw...

comments.author: The Sceptical Chymist
comments.body: Quote from: Mpamaegbu on October 07, 2022, 05:50:20 AMFactoid â€“ An inaccurate statement or statistic believed to be true because of broad repetition, especially if cited in the media.I can't speak for anyone other than myself, but when I see the word "factoid" I don't immediately think it's referring to an untruth but rather a small snippet of something true about a particular issue that doesn't delve into minute details.Â  Personally, I think it's an appropriate wording in this case, though obviously if someone not familiar with the word looks it up like you did, they might come to the wrong conclusion about the content."Facts" or "fact list" or "summary of facts" would be decent choices too IMO.And yes, I'd like to see this get written, and as to the bitcoin/PoW thing, I don't see why they both can't be mentioned in the same line--like I just wrote it, because it kills two birds with one stone.
